archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Gochujang-Chipotle Pork Belly Tacos with Sesame-Lime Slaw and Quick Pickled Red Onions
description: Hot, crunchy, and saucy tacos: charred gochujang-marinated pork belly, a crisp sesame-lime cabbage slaw, and punchy pickled red onions, finished with a smoky gochujang-chipotle salsa.
prep_steps: In a bowl, whisk gochujang, soy sauce, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, honey, minced garlic, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1/2 tsp salt, and black pepper. Toss pork belly in marinade; chill 15–20 minutes.
Shred cabbage. Chop coriander. Halve and juice limes.
Make slaw: In a large bowl, toss cabbage with 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1–2 tbsp lime juice, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, and 1/2 tsp salt. Fold in chopped coriander; set aside.
Pickle red onion: Thinly slice red onion and place in a small bowl with 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, and a pinch of salt. Toss and let sit.
Make spicy salsa: Stir salsa with chipotle sauce and 1 tbsp gochujang (optional extra heat).
Preheat an outdoor grill (medium-high, well-oiled grates) or heat a large stovetop skillet over medium-high with a thin film of oil.
cook_steps: Grill or sear pork belly in a single layer until deeply caramelized and slightly charred, 2–3 minutes per side. Cook in batches; rest on a plate.
Warm tortillas on the grill or in a dry pan until pliable and lightly charred; wrap in a clean towel to keep warm.
Assemble tacos: Add a handful of sesame-lime slaw to each tortilla, pile on pork belly, spoon over the gochujang-chipotle salsa, then top with quick pickled red onions and jalapenos.
Serve immediately with extra lime wedges (from the limes used) if desired.

ingredients.preparation: 3 tbsp for marinade, 1 tbsp for salsa (optional)

final_ingredients.preparation: 3 tbsp for marinade, 1 tbsp for salsa (optional)
